full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 60 of 197 2601 LCHVMAX2 Richards - direct 1 Q. Right. And you've done a lot of interviews between 14 years ago and now, I assume? 2 A. Probably thousands. 3 Q. Now, is part of the reason why you are trained to take 4 notes and to record events accurately, so that months or years 5 later you will have a document such as this that you can 6 testify from and be confident that what you put in the document 7 is accurate? 8 A. That's for reference, yes. 9 Q. Okay. What I'd like to do is direct you to some specific 10 statements in this JR-1 that we've marked for identification 11 purposes. 12 13 First of all, do you recall that on August 7th, 2007, 14 you spoke with Carolyn? And we're identifying this person only 15 by the name of "Carolyn." 16 A. Yes. 17 Q. And again, when you spoke with Carolyn, you were gathering 18 information relative to your investigation at that time; 19 correct? 20 A. That's correct. 21 Q. When you spoke with Carolyn, consistent with your training 22 and experience, you were attempting to get as much information 23 as possible; is that correct? 24 A. Yes. 25 Q. And you were not limiting any of the responses given to you  SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00014166

1 Q. Right. And you've done a lot of interviews between 14 years ago and now, I assume? 2 A. Probably thousands. 3 Q. Now, is part of the reason why you are trained to take 4 notes and to record events accurately, so that months or years 5 later you will have a document such as this that you can 6 testify from and be confident that what you put in the document 7 is accurate? 8 A. That's for reference, yes. 9 Q. Okay. What I'd like to do is direct you to some specific 10 statements in this JR-1 that we've marked for identification 11 purposes. 12 13 First of all, do you recall that on August 7th, 2007, 14 you spoke with Carolyn? And we're identifying this person only 15 by the name of "Carolyn." 16 A. Yes. 17 Q. And again, when you spoke with Carolyn, you were gathering 18 information relative to your investigation at that time; 19 correct? 20 A. That's correct. 21 Q. When you spoke with Carolyn, consistent with your training 22 and experience, you were attempting to get as much information 23 as possible; is that correct? 24 A. Yes. 25 Q. And you were not limiting any of the responses given to you
